1390420.name: Billy Saves the World
1390420.description:
BILLY SAVES THE WORLD give you ULTIMATE FREEDOM

Play and progress how you prefer. Head straight for the end with the bare minimum for the most difficult experience, or, make your journey easier by obtaining upgrades in a number of different ways and play styles:

>>Take a slower approach and explore a hand crafted open world.
>>Solve puzzles and help dozens of unique NPCs through rich (hilarious & heartfelt) side-quests.
>>Beat challenging old-school platforming stages (plus time trials!).
All of the above will earn you "SP" that you can use to purchase upgrades and new abilities to help you on your quest. This means you can prioritize puzzles over platforming, or, if you hate puzzles, skip them in favor of action.

How you play is entirely up to you. It's a unique blend of gameplay that has fans saying it is, "Re-Defining A Genre."

Every single level and quest contains several approaches, solutions, paths, and outcomes. Meaning the choices you make -- both in dialogue and through gameplay, will carve out a unique single player experience, on par with AAA studio offerings.

A NARRATIVE-DRIVEN platformer

Yes, there's reading, but how much you get is generally in your control. Don't like reading? Don't talk to people.

The story itself may seem silly and superficial on the surface, but for those who roll credits, you will be taken on a surprisingly emotional ride, one that you won't regret taking.

After letting his girlfriend down for the last time, Billy is swiftly dumped on his two-year anniversary. While walking home alone in the rain, a mysterious portal swallows him up and spits him out on a distant alien world.

It is here that Billy will learn to become the dependable person he should have always been.

Oh, and save the world, too.

  • FEATURING ONE OF THE YEAR'S BEST SOUNDTRACKS. Composed by John McMillan (Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag) and multi-platinum producer, Tom Ratesic (Nicki Minaj, Lil Wayne). Audio by Jonathan Beres (Game of Thrones).

  • INSPIRED BY "FUTURAMA" AND "CURSE OF MONKEY ISLAND". Choose your dialogue in this comedic sci-fi love story that appears silly on the surface but offers a meaningful message of personal growth & acceptance, written by award-winning filmmaker, Cooper Bibaud. 

  • NO HAND HOLDING. The varied play styles, approaches, branching narratives, solutions, and secret paths are seamlessly woven into the game. It's up to you to experiment how you want to progress through it. You won't find giant glowing arrows showing you all the different choices you can make. Just play.

  • TOP FILM & TV ANIMATORS. Run, Slide, Jump, Rocket-Boost, Wall-Jump, and use Jedi-like super powers to explore a dense 2D open-ish world, featuring 7+ diverse biomes with beautifully hand drawn environments and frame by frame animation.

  • Solve over 25 side-quests with multiple dialogue branches, solutions and outcomes based on what you say and do. Packed with 30+ optional levels to beat, each containing different routes, unique enemies, deadly traps, creative puzzles, secret collectibles, and nail biting time trials. 

  • An average of 8 hours of gameplay (and well over 20+ for completionists). Wowee!

Join the official Discord channel for the latest news & announcements, chat directly with the creator, PLUS receive exclusive videos, images, WIPs and more.

highlighted.name: A Certain Time, A Certain Place
